diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis s/p cholecystostomy drain placement
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with sudden onset right upper quadrant pain, nausea, and vomiting. An ultrasound revealed a thickened gallbladder wall with pericholecystic fluid, which is indicative of acute cholecystitis. The patient also has a history of metastatic cholangiocarcinoma, which was considered in the differential diagnosis.
